title: Is it uncommon for musicians to edit their own music videos? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not at all, in fact there are people who started that way making “home movie” type videos before they had the backing of a whole management and production company behind them to take the job over and produce a whole choreographed production. I won’t name names, but if you look at some older YT videos, you can find a few. Everybody has to start someplace, and it isn’t that hard with today’s digital cameras and computer video editing software, even the freebies like iMovie work well enough to start.

I’m not a musician, but my opinion is that it would be quite common. Especially if you’re an independent artist. Most independent artists starting out have no money for a dedicated professional to do it for them.
